caption: This sculpture in the Tuileries Gardens is called Nobody's Friend (L'Oeuvre L'Ami de Personne) and is the work of Swedish sculptor Erik Dietman and was installed in 1999.  What you see is a bronze of a vague and peculiar shaped creature with certain humanoid features as well as what seems like a small seat. It is a quirky find in the Tuileries Garden, potentially worth finding if you enjoy viewing abstract sculptures.

Nobody's Friend is a work by Swedish sculptor Erik Dietman located in Paris, France. Made in 1992 and installed in 1999 in the Tuileries Gardens, it is a bronze sculpture. The work takes the form of a bronze sculpture representing a vaguely humanoid shape. He seems to be staring at an empty chair (resembling the freely accessible chairs in the Tuileries Garden), placed in front of the sculpture; This chair is made of galvanized steel and fixed to the floor. The work is installed in a grove of the Tuileries Garden. Nobody's Friend is a 1992 work by Erik Dietman. Publicly commissioned by the French state, it was created in 1999 and installed in the Tuileries Gardens.

I just discovered in my photo that there is a chair that is part of the scene. Maybe one day I'll go talk to him ü§≠ A very special character where many have taken a pose sitting in his hand given its satin appearanceüòâ ‚Ä¶

Interesting work composed of a statue with a confusingly humanoid shape and an empty chair facing it. When we see it we turn around to understand it better. We can see an outstretched hand depending on its position. I liked it.

Nobody's Friend was commissioned from the artist Erik DIETMAN (1937-2002) in 1998 for installation in the Tuileries garden. Make patinated bronze (figure) and galvanized steel (chair). Deposited by the National Center for Visual Arts in 2000. Most visitors are not aware that the small metal chair in front of the statue is part of it.

If we had fewer preconceptions about what we discover every day, if we were more attentive to those we encounter on a daily basis, undoubtedly life and humans would be better and happier. You're not anyone's friend, you just haven't met the person who will open their heart to you yet.
There are many interesting modern sculptures in the garden.
